intro: Verbena lorentzii, commonly known as the Mexican verbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Verbena lorentzii is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
